author: Christophoclese
body:
It does not appear that the PowerShell Core on Ubuntu 16.04, installed on the Linux Subsystem for Windows 10, honors installed CA certificates.

# Steps to reproduce
Attempt to connect to internal resource, fails due to invalid certificate chain/validation:
```
PS /home/cbarton> Invoke-RestMethod -Method 'GET' -Uri 'https://icusuite.somedomain.net'
Invoke-RestMethod : The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-RestMethod -Method 'GET' -Uri 'https://icusuite.somedomain.net'
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (Method: GET, Re...rShell/6.1.1
}:HttpRequestMessage) [Invoke-RestMethod], HttpRequestException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletWebResponseException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeRestMethodCommand
```

Make same call with the Ubuntu subsystem's `curl` utility, successfully connects using the subsystem's CA certificates: 
```
PS /home/cbarton> curl https://icusuite.somedomain.net
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <meta charset="UTF-8">
        <title>ICU Suite</title>

        <!--
        <head>ICU Suite Home (TO COMPLETE)</head>
        <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; url=incident-command-console/" />
        -->

        <script>
            window.location = "incident-command-console/";
        </script>

    </head>
    <body>
    </body>
</html>
```

# Expected Result
PowerShell should honor the underlying system's trusted SSL relationships, and/or provide a clear method for specifying which certificates should be used to evaluate trust.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@Christophoclese Thanks for your report! 
PowerShell Core uses .Net Core HttpClient. I think the issue should be moved to CoreFX repository.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Please include the version of PowerShell Core that you used to repro the problem?  There were significant changes (to DotNet Core's HttpClient) between `6.0` and `6.1`

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Is this a certificate you added or built into `ca-certificates`?  Would it be possible to give an actual domain we can verify against.  There is a [variable](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docker/blob/7dd20469ed66305428fbb8af90032376e9a5a90e/release/community-stable/kali-rolling/docker/Dockerfile#L82) in DotNet 2.1 (which we use in PowerShell Core 6.1) to force it to use `libcurl`.
